title: Buggy's God Valley Connection Theory
summary: Theory that Buggy, like Shanks, originated from God Valley and may be the son of Rocks D. Xebec, with Roger taking him in to protect his identity.
fullText: Fans have theorized that Buggy and Shanks were both raised together on the Oro Jackson after being taken from God Valley by Gol D. Roger. Both are 39 years old, suggesting they were both infants during the God Valley Incident. Some theories suggest Buggy could be the son of Rocks D. Xebec, which would explain why Roger took him in - to prevent the World Government from discovering and eliminating Rocks' bloodline. This theory gained traction after Episode 452 revealed Buggy's connection to Roger's crew, making fans wonder about the deeper significance of his past.
author: Multiple Reddit Users on r/OnePiece

source.title: One Piece: Why Buggy's True Identity Will Shock The World

title: Buggy as the 'Certain Pirate' Shanks Mentioned
summary: Theory that Buggy the Clown could be the 'certain pirate' Shanks mentioned to the Gorosei, given his unexpected rise to power and deep connections.
fullText: After Episode 452's revelation of Buggy's Roger Pirates past and connection to Shanks, fans theorized that Buggy might be the 'certain pirate' Shanks wanted to discuss with the Gorosei. The theory suggests that despite his comedic portrayal, Buggy may have deeper significance to the world's mysteries. As a former Roger Pirate who was present for much of the journey (though he didn't go to Laugh Tale), Buggy possesses knowledge that could be dangerous. His improbable rise from small-time pirate to Warlord to Yonko, all triggered by the revelation in this episode, suggests destiny is guiding him toward a significant role in the final saga.
author: Reddit User: OnePieceTheoryMaster

title: Buggy's Luck is Actually a Devil Fruit Power
summary: Theory that Buggy's incredible luck, which allowed him to become a Yonko despite weak combat abilities, might actually be an unknown Devil Fruit power.
fullText: Fans have theorized that Buggy's seemingly impossible luck - from surviving encounters with powerful enemies to his rise to Yonko status starting with Episode 452's revelation - might not be luck at all, but an unconscious Devil Fruit ability. The theory suggests Buggy may have eaten a second Devil Fruit that grants probability manipulation or fate alteration, but because it's passive and unconscious, Buggy himself doesn't realize it. This would explain how the revelation of his Roger Pirates past in Episode 452 led to such an improbable series of events that elevated him to Emperor status. Critics point out this violates the established rule that eating two Devil Fruits kills you, though some theorize Buggy's unique body composition from the Bara Bara no Mi might allow it.
author: YouTube Theorist: GrandLineReview

source.title: One Piece: Buggy's Rise To Yonko, Explained

title: Shiryu Will Fight Zoro in Final War
summary: Theory that Shiryu, who joined Blackbeard in Episode 452, is being set up as Zoro's final major opponent, paralleling Luffy vs Blackbeard.
fullText: After Shiryu joined Blackbeard's crew in Episode 452, fans immediately theorized that he's being positioned as Zoro's endgame opponent. The theory is based on several parallels: both are swordsmen, both are second-strongest in their respective crews, and Shiryu's invisibility power (later acquired) would test Zoro's Observation Haki to its limits. The theory gained more support after Shiryu acquired the Clear-Clear Fruit, as fans noted this creates a perfect challenge for Zoro - he'll need to defeat a master swordsman he cannot see, forcing him to rely entirely on Haki and his other senses. Episode 452 marked the beginning of this narrative parallel, with Shiryu's recruitment mirroring Zoro's role in the Straw Hat crew.
author: Multiple One Piece Theory Channels

source.title: One Piece: Shiryu's Suke Suke no Mi, Explained

title: Blackbeard's Full Devil Fruit Crew Theory
summary: Theory that Blackbeard is systematically recruiting powerful Devil Fruit users, with Shiryu's recruitment in Episode 452 being an early example of this strategy.
fullText: Fans theorized after Episode 452 that Blackbeard's recruitment of Shiryu (and later giving him Absalom's Devil Fruit) revealed a larger pattern - Blackbeard is building a crew where every member has a powerful Devil Fruit ability. The theory suggests Blackbeard's unique ability to wield multiple Devil Fruits extends to his crew members in some way, or that he's hunting specific fruits for specific crew members to maximize their combat potential. Evidence includes: Shiryu getting the Clear-Clear Fruit, Jesus Burgess seeking the Mera Mera no Mi, and other crew members later acquiring powerful abilities. Episode 452's recruitment of Shiryu marked an early step in this master plan, as Blackbeard recognized Shiryu's potential and likely already had a Devil Fruit in mind for him.

title: Buggy's Reputation Will Save the World Theory
summary: Theory that Buggy's inflated reputation, starting with Episode 452's revelation, will play a crucial role in preventing global catastrophe in the final war.
fullText: After Episode 452 revealed Buggy's Roger Pirates connection and showed how it instantly elevated his reputation, fans theorized this pattern would continue until Buggy's false reputation becomes so legendary that it actually affects the final war's outcome. The theory suggests that while Buggy has minimal actual combat strength, his perceived power (as a Roger Pirate, Shanks' rival, Warlord, and eventually Yonko) will cause enemies to make strategic errors or allies to take heart. In the climactic final battle, Buggy's presence and reputation might prevent all-out war or unite disparate factions, making his 'luck' and inflated status the key to saving the world - not through power, but through perception. Episode 452 was the crucial first domino in this chain of events.
